questions.title: How do employees and teams typically work together?
options: Strong social bond, collective success, and we-over-me
Highly flexible, experimental, and adaptive
Competitive, individual accountability, and goal-oriented
Defined roles, structured teamwork, and siloed collaboration

questions.title: Which leadership styles do you think are most effective for driving success and achieving organizational goals?
options: Supportive, mentoring, and people-first
Visionary, risk-taking, and innovation focused
Results-oriented, and competitive
Process-driven, structured, and efficiency-focused

questions.title: Which of the following best describes the overall environment of the organization?
options: A close-knit, family-like culture with trust and collaboration
An innovative, risk-taking environment focused on experimentation
A results-driven, high-performance workplace with competitive energy
A structured, process-oriented organization emphasizing stability

questions.title: How comfortable is your organization with trying new ideas?
options: Open to experimenting with new ideas, through collaboration and teamwork
Highly comfortable with new ideas, prioritizing creativity, risk-taking, and innovative solutions
Generally comfortable with new ideas that can enhance competitiveness and profitability
Less comfortable with new ideas, favoring established processes and traditional methods

questions.title: What primarily drives employee engagement and motivation?
options: A sense of belonging, shared values, and mutual support
Constant new challenges, creativity, and continuous innovation
Winning in the market, performance-based rewards
Pride in brand legacy fosters with aspirational leadership and visible authority

questions.title: How does your organization approach confidentiality?
options: Trust-Based – Shared openly within teams. Employees protect information out of mutual respect
Independent Responsibility – Open discussions with clear boundaries on what stays confidential to balance creativity with security
Business-Driven – Strict rules to protect business advantage. Breaches have serious consequences
Highly Regulated – Clear rules and policies in place, with limited access to confidential information

questions.title: What is the type of environment that defines your client experience ?
options: Warm & Social: Inviting, connected, culturally integrated
Bold & Experimental: Disruptive, exploratory, visionary
State-of-the-Art Experience: Cutting-edge, experience-led, transparent, innovative
Capability and legacy driven: Timeless, refined, honoring tradition with modernity

questions.title: What are the different types of social & interpersonal interactions at work?
options: Personal Check-ins: Conversations about life outside of work, fostering genuine connections
Coffee Break Conversations: Short, relaxed interactions that refresh and connect employees
Hallway Hellos: Casual, spontaneous chats that build camaraderie
Milestone celebrations: Team lunches or events to mark achievements
